src:
11 Preman yang Kerap Palak Pedagang Ditangkap Polisi di Jakbar
01 Nov 2019, 11:23 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah
Jakarta - Jajaran Polres Metro Jakarta Barat mengamankan 11 preman yang kerap memalak pedagang di Pasar Darurat Kapuk, Jakarta Barat. Selain kerap memalak, preman ini menguasai lahan sekitar pasar.
Kasat Reskrim Polres Metro Jakarta Barat AKBP Edy Suratna Sitepu mengatakan pihaknya mendapat informasi dari masyarakat terkait banyaknya aksi premanisme yang meresahkan warga Jakbar, khususnya di daerah Kapuk. Menindaklanjuti laporan itu, polisi bergerak mengamankan 11 preman pada Rabu (30/10) lalu.
"Satuan Reskrim Polres Metro Jakarta Barat berhasil mengamankan sebanyak 11 orang preman yang menduduki sebuah lahan pasar lapangan bola, pasar darurat di Kapuk Jakarta Barat," kata AKBP Edy dalam keterangannya kepada wartawan, Jumat (1/11/2019).



Para preman ini disebut Edy kerap meresahkan masyarakat sekitar dengan cara memalak. Mereka juga memalak para pedagang di sekitar lokasi.
"Para pelaku ditengarai meminta sejumlah uang kepada para pedagang di sekitar lokasi pasar," jelas Edy.
text:
11 Thugs Who Often Palak Traders Arrested by Police in West Jakarta
Nov 01 2019, 11:23 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah
Jakarta - West Jakarta Metro Police ranks secure 11 thugs who often scold traders in the Kapuk Emergency Market, West Jakarta. Aside from being often angry, these thugs control the land around the market.
Head of West Jakarta Metro Police Criminal Investigation Unit AKBP Edy Suratna Sitepu said that his party received information from the public regarding the many acts of thuggery that troubled West Jakarta residents, especially in the Kapuk area. Following up on the report, the police moved to secure 11 thugs last Wednesday (30/10).
"The West Jakarta Metro Police Criminal Unit succeeded in securing as many as 11 thugs who occupied a soccer field market area, an emergency market in Kapuk, West Jakarta," AKBP Edy said in his statement to reporters on Friday (1/11/2019).



These thugs, called Edy, often make people uneasy about their way by yelping. They also scolded traders around the location.
"The perpetrators are suspected of asking for some money from traders around the market location," explained Edy.
